title: Plugging in $$0$$
text: The x-intercept lies at the point of a function where the y-value is zero.

title: Plugging in $$0$$
text: So, we have to set the equation to: $$0=\sqrt[3]{3x+1}$$.

title: Plugging in $$0$$
text: What value of $$x$$ makes this equation true?

title: Simplifying the Equation
text: When we square both sides, we get that $$0=3x+1$$.

title: Simplifying the Equation
text: Then, we subtract $$1$$ from both sides to get $$-1=3x$$.

title: Simplifying the Equation
text: Finally, we divide both sides by $$3$$ to get $$x=\frac{-1}{3}$$.
